li.div:
Present perfect continuous
….... + have/has + been + V – ing + …. + for / since …....
Samples of conditions:
for ten years, for a month, for a while, all day, since 1 april, sinse + Past simple

He has been discovering new kinds of animals in this cry for ten years.
I have been working on that plant for years.
Using Have been …....... have been ….../ …......... был …........
I have been in the neighbor city, there is no interesting things.

Using last and first in Past simple
…........ + first + V2
…........+ last + V2
…........... + was + first …........
…........ + was + last + ….........

I first swam at 24.
I last ate the pineapple many years ago.

Past continuous I, he, she, it + was + V-ing ( + when + Past simple)
We, you, they + were + V-ing ( + when + Past simple)

I was taking a shower when you called.
They were explaining me the main principle of quantum mechanics yesterday.
Simple questions

Did you tell her the truth? Yes, I did. No, I did'nt.
Have you sold your car? Yes, I have. No, I have'nt.

li.h3: Prepositions of time, words about the time

li.div: Still, So far (до сих пор)

I still don't have a book for the exam preparation. (The main thing is I don't have a book)
The weather was quiet so far. (But it may change soon)

Until, till (till = until), up to (….. до …...)
…....... until + {time, Present simple, past simple}

I will be preparing for the party until evening.
We played football until Jon's mother said he must go home.
There will be many people asking about the party up to evening.

Already, yet
There prepositions are used only in Perfect tenses.
…........... + have/has/had already + V-3+...........
….......... + have'nt/ has'nt / had'nt + V3 + ….. + yet.

I have already read you writings, there are many interesting thoughts, I must say.
I have'nt found out the reason of tainting of the water yet.

Already, yet in other tenses
We can use already and yet in other tenses
…............... already …..........
…................ yet …..............

He is quite skillful driver already.
That time he did'nt have any clues for solving this task yet.
By (до определенного момента, к определенному моменту)

The building had been demolished by the moment of my arrival, I could'nt do anything.
You should adjust your room by afternoon, little bastard!
They told me the car will have been repaired by monday.
Once , one day (однажды)

Once I was by the seashore and saw a very beautiful ship with white sails.
One day I was so close to my dream.
Once (один раз), Twice (два раза)

I just asked you just once about little help, but you was so busy with you homework.
I saw clearly he turned the key twice.

He goes to school five times a week.
He repaired his car many times, but it still breaks, bringing many issues to his life.
This time, that time

This time I will fix all my mistakes.
That time I was'nt ready for such sudden vortex of events.
Nowadays, At present

Nowadays, there are many ways to entertain yourself.
At present he is addicted in gambling, so we don't have extra money.
At once (сразу, немедленно, одновременно), Simultanuously, At the same time

You had to catch them at once, why you allowed them to deceive you.
Sorry, I could listen and catch them at once.
So, I supposed to be here and at school at the same time.
It has been + …. + hours, years + …....+ (since)
It has been ten hours. Where have you been?
….. out of the year / …... в году
He will visit you for days out of the year, one day from each season.

Longer expressions …...... any longer / больше не......
…....... longer …..../дольше

Common decision was to stop tolerate it any longer.
You should exercise longer to develop your muscles.
…........ anymore / сколько-нибудь ещё
I can't listen your crying anymore.
…........no longer than ….... /не дольше чем
I am planning to spend in the gym no longer then two hours.
Meanwhile, …................/ тем временем, ….........
Meanwhile, they were trying to start the car.
At the meantime, …............/ в то же время, ….............
At the meantime, they were trying to catch that red butterfly to entertain their child.
Fortunately, Unfortunately, …......................

Fortunately, we was ready to meed our formidable enemy.
Unfortunately, the car was too old to win the race.
Luckily, there were a couple of bottles with water.
Finally, the meal was cooked and lured all members of the family.
Generally speaking, …...............
Generally speaking, this feature is very important.
In conclusion, …..............
In conclusion, it must be said about modern technologies in this field.
In summary, …........
In summary, this role of stomach is very important in digestion.
In addition, ….............
In addition, I want to tell you about the rainbow.
In general, …....
In general, this habitat is not appropriate for this genus.
To begin with, ….... (прежде всего)
To begin with, you should listen an introduction before judge about something.
No doubt, ….......
No doubt, he knows the truth.
In short words, ….... (в кратце)
In short words, this trip will be the most dangerous in this year.
By the way, ….... (кстати, между тем)
By the way, I heard you bought a new car, receive my congratulations.
With regard to …........... (в связи, применительно, по отношению, что касается)

With regard to my departure, I want to empower you to take take about the household.
It is impossible with regard to you weakness to take part in competition.
My goodness, ….....
My goodness, what are you doing in this unsafe place?
In fact, ….....
In fact, it was just a little and ligh parcel.
To be honest, …....
To be honest, I did'nt intend to give you my bicycle.
After all

After all you have a very decent truck.
There are many togs in your shelf after all.
Therefore, Thus, So, Then, Hence, Consequently

We were hungry as a bears after the hilbernation. Therefore we decided to order the pizza.
Our car was fueled, our backpacks were full of food. Thus, we were ready for our adventure.
The sky was very blue. So, we could walk not being afraid of the sudden rain.
At first you should find a map. Then you will have a chance to find an artifact.
This car is very expensive. Hence, you have to stash quite long.
We don't know the password. Consequently, we should pick it, using our skills.
…...., namely …... (А именно)
There were baloons of different colours, namely green, blue, red.
Overall, she is very neat and kind girl, and she is the best student in her group
I earned money for my vacation trip. Likewise, I must earn money for the new car.

There was a big crowd on the square because the feast was arranged very badly.
You can't pass there because of your car size.

Due to your strong zeal, I will show you result of my expierement on mices.
It was'nt finished because I was disturbed by the band of audacious bastards.
I bought this wonderfull coat in the shop wherein your mother works.

Although I couldn help you with your homework, I think I can afford to blackmain our teacher a little.
Even though this watch is very expensive, you must get it for the Christmas present.
Though this car is clean, I am going to clean it again.
Despite your unpoliteness to me, I will continue to help you in difficult life situations.
However, Nevertheless

The party was full of interesting prominent people. However, it was very boring in general.
Everyone thought he could'nt commit so brave action. Nevertheless, he did it without faltering.
Nonetheless
It was a difficult fight, nonetheless they managed to survive.
Regardless of the severity of the local climate, we must adapt for living here.
Unlike the winter, the summer is very funny here and provides a real possibility to feel happy.

It was wonderfull sunny day, but is was spoiled by suddenly appeared clouds.
We are not going to toss, there are no people who knows the medicine but you.
He collected all figures of superheroes except the rarest on of star captain.
The morning was very tranquill, yet there was a couple of bustlers running to the train station.
Beside, Besides

I saw a weird lighting beside the lighthouse yesterday.
Besides the zoo, there are many other places to entertain you child.
Besides, I want to ask you about the possible job it the city for me.

li.h3: Comparisons and comparison degrees and quantity

li.div: Little, a little, Few, a few

There is too little water in the pitcher.
I need a little money to buy a used car.
You have few nails to complete your barn.
May be I will ask you for a few nails.
Less, Fewer

Actually you need less gasoline to come there, it is not so far.
To be honest, this meal can be cooked by fewer ingridients.
Low, lower

The water level is very low.
Actually the temperature is lower here.
Many, Much, a lot of, a plenty of

I know you have many aces in your sleeve.
There is much water in the basin.
I could see a lot of strange things in that cave.
There are a plenty of grammar rules in that book.

Сравнительная степень прилагательных
For words which have 1 or 2 syllables:
….... + adjective – er + ….........
….....+ Word -er + then ….......
For words which have more than 2 syllables:
…...... + more + adjectiv + …....
…...... + more + adjective+ then ….........

That prom was brighter then it used to be before.
The homework was more difficult then previous one.

Кратная сравнительная степень
…..... + N times + adjective – er + …...........
…...... + N times+ more + adjectiv + …....

This future building is going to be two times higher then Elbrus.
This task is five times more difficult then any task you were solving before.

Превосходная степень прилагательных
For short words:
….... + adjective – est + …...
For long words:
…..... + the most adjective + …........

He is the strongest participant of the contest.
It is the most tranquill place in the country, even the birds don't sing here.
He likes to walk in this tranquill forest at most.

Exceptions:
good / better / best
bad / worse / worst
many, much / more / most
The ….. -er, the …... -er
The stronger rains in the spring, the better crop will be harvested in the end of the summer.
I can stay here as a guest.
He swims like a fish. He store a water in the barrel as a camel in his hump.
You did this as fast as Jane usually does.
You did your homework not as good as you usually do.
There were so many birds as a tone of grain was spilled there.

We should take as many napkins as we can.
You should drink as much water as you can.

As this sword is extremely expensive, we should discuss this purchase together.
Since there are many ways to solve your problems, you had better wait a little before any action.
As well as, As well

You should find an armour, shield as well as a very good sword.
To cook this soup you need a couple of potatoes, carrots and a bunch of greenery as well.
I think she can play as well as you do. So, she is very formidable opponent for you.
As far as I am concerned,
As far as I am concerned, she can't blame you, because actually you are not guilty.
As far as
You must'nt go as far as this mark.
As far as + V
As far as I know, you are very dilligant student. As far as I see, you are very tight guy.

li.h3: Should, Must, Have to, Be to

li.div:
….... + Should + V + …......... / …...тебе следует ….....
…..... + Should + have + V3 + ….......... / …... тебе следовало бы …....

You should tell me everything you saw that day on the carnival.
You should have bought that ring, you know it is very important for us.
You must buy a car, there are no buses and trains in this city at all.
You must not walk in this sacred forest.

You must be that forester I heard from Jimm.
I must have been very cold he decided to skip that meeting.

You have to help me with my motorcycle.
We had to fuel our car, I feel it.
We will have to visit Joe's friend in the inn.

You have to help me with my motorcycle.
We had to fuel our car, I feel it.
We will have to visit Joe's friend in the inn.

We don't have to reveal our trump cards to you, because you even did'nt tell us your name.
I did'nt have to provide my protection at all.
I am to finish my book, because in my opinion it will become very popular.
Had better + V, had better not + V

You have better find another person for talking, I am tired listening your lamenting.
I think we had better not buy this car, it is so expensive.
….. + is supposed to + V + …..........

Притяжательные местоимения I my mine me
you your yours you
he his his him
she her hers her
it its it
we our ours us
they their theirs them

Притяжательный падеж
N + 's + N …....../ чей-то
Don't touch Elizabeth's books. She hates when hers private space is violated.

Местоимения
This, That, These, Those

This day will be full of joys, if my plan works correctly.
That book is not relevant for exam preparation.
These fruits are stale, you had better discard them.
That sword is too rusty to be used in the fight.
Those + …............. (мы можем опустить существительное с местоимением those)
Those who want breathe a fresh air should raise their hand.
Both + N, Both of + pronoun, Pronoun + both

Both scientists were very curious about that planet.
Both of them were interested in life on another planets.
They both believed that it is difficult to ride a bicycle.

Both person1 and person2
….. both V and V
…... both N and N
…... both adjective and adjective

Both Jim and Alex wanted to become a president of the class.
They both were swimming and diving.
They were collecting both mushrooms and berries.
The baloons in the room of little girl were both green and blue.
On its own, itself

Thank you for your proposal, but I think I can manage on my own.
I would be better for you as for apprentice beginner to do it yourself.
…......is …......... itself / собственно …........

It is a great master himself, he will help you and teach you how to get a black belt.
At first you need our textbook itself.
Out there / туда, там, оттуда …........ (=There)
It is very cold out there in the north.

Attributive clauses
who, that, which, why, whom

We cam miss on of the words above, it noun is not primary.
I saw that people who discussed you. I saw that people discussed you.

The object clause
N + V + what, where ….. + ….
N + V + …..............

Predicative clause
N + be, is, will be + ….............
Question is why did you sell your amazing bicycle.

There is very interesting book on your writing desk, you had better read it, I am sure you will like it.
There are many especiall guests on the party, are you really sure you don't want to go there?

Conditionals
0. N + V if …. N + V
1. N + will V if …..N + V
2. N + would + V if ….. N + V2
3. N + would have V3 if …... N + had + V3

The plant withers if it doesn't get a sun energy and the water.
The feast will be very bright if you participate in it, I am sure.
It would be very cold if it was a winter.
We would have won if you had'nt sold that stupid ticket.

Conditionals with When
N + will V …. when + N + V (present simple)
I will begin my preparations for the birthday when she comes back.

I wish …....
1. I wish + I + V2 (Present)
2. I wish + I + had + V3 (Past)
3. I wish + I + would + V (Future)
I wish I was a great athlete.
I wish I had bought that car on the exhibition.
I wish we would be kinder to each other in the next year.
I want you to help me in choosing new car.
It is not wonder

It is not wonder you saw many soldiers yesterday. We will see a military parade tomorrow.
It is not wonder he has problems with obesity, because he eats sugar as a machine.
I wonder

I wonder where she learnt to cook so delicious meal, even Henry cant cook it properly.
I wonder how could you buy this car for so little amount of money?
Whatever you did with my toys, I will forgive you.
Whatsoever you saw there, we must find out what was that.
Whenever you come, I will keep a hot meal for you.
Wherever you have been, I suppose you had very nice time instead sitting with our child.
Whatever you say, they are true professionals in their matter.

Numerals
Hundreds of N-s
On hundred N-s …...
One tenth / 1/10
Two tenth / 2/10

There were millions of hungry creatures.
This building may be sold for up to ten million dollars.
He decided to add a one tenth of the glass of water.
The glass was full on two tenth.
Per (в день, за тонну, на человека)

This plant must be watered three times per day.
You promised to pay me a hundred bucks per tonn.
The government will allot a one thousand dollars per person with regard to the pandemic.
Each, Every

Each member of the team has his especial abilities.
He is going to cook a pizza every day.
May, Might

Dont forget to put on a coat, it may be cold this evening, I heard the forecast from TV.
It may be difficult to confess about your love, but you don't have other ways.
You might tell about your feelings, but you had decided to keep it inside.
I heard his weapons are very mighty.
Need, needed
I need a couple of gloves. I need to buy a little flour to cook the pizza.

Would like, would rather, would prefer, rather than
….. + Would like + ….... / я бы хотел
I would like to eat up a couple of icecreams right now to cool my heated body.
…....+ Would rather + …..../ я бы предпочел
I would prefer to stay at home instead going to zoo.
….... + Would prefer + …... / я бы предпочел
I would prefer to cook this pie without the sugar, only with honey.
I think we should go to the museum rather then to the theater.
Quite / вполне
He is quite clever boy to recognize a trap.
Pretty / вполне
This costume is pretty good for meeting.
Rather / довольно
The weapther was rather wet, but we decided to set off.
Fairly / вполне, но могло быть и лучше
Your skills are fairly high. But you could improve them further.
Very / очень
I suppose your desire to know the truth is intransigent.
1. Указывает на того (или что), кто совершил действие в пассивных конструкциях
We are protected by a small army of fairies.
2. Выражает близость
I was sitting by the fireplace and dreaming about my future.
3. Выражает действие с определенной целью
You definetely can sell it by reducing the price.
4. Выражает метод
I can come to you only by train this time. All roads are blocked.
5. Выражает предмет сравнения:
This city is on the first place in the country by population.
1. Показывает, с помощью чего совершено действие
Are you going to break this door with this hammer?
2. Используется, чтобы выразить участие
You can check that dark forest with you.
3. Используется для выражения обладания
I am interested in that man with white eyes.
4. Ставится перед название чувства или эмоции
You must not do it with emotions, you should be absolutely patient.
5. Выражает согласие
I agree with you.
1. Указывает на действие, совершенное без чего-либо
Did you really do in without the internet? Yes, I just used books in the library.
2. Указывает на необладание чем-то
It is the same to drive a car without the wheels.
3. Указывает на несовместность действия
This task can't be done without his knowledge.
Next to, Near, Nearby

I want you to sit next to me and listen the whole story.
I saw a strange crater near the lake.
I am talking about nearby lake.
Opposite, behind, in front of

He sat opposite me and began to recite the book was on the old wooden table.
There were a few chairs behind the table.
A very strange man stood in front of me and trying to show me a queer gesture.
About

It is about five meters length.
He read about twenty books during his study.
Word miss (опоздать, скучать по кому-либо, отсутствовать, пропустить, промахнуться)

I missed for ten minutes, I am sorry.
Living in that house in the woods, I was missing you very much.
He can't answer you, he is missing now.
I decided to come earlier, because I don't want to miss the train.
He missed, because target was too swift.

Кидать
Throw, threw , thrown
Cast, cast, cast
Fling, flang, flung
Hurl, hurled, hurled
Discard

Word pass
Проход, ущелье, пропуск
Проходить, пересекать, сдать экзамен, передавать (в другие руки), проводить время, проходить (о времени)

How could you know about this pass?
There is a narrow pass in the mountains.
Do you have a pass to the party?
You have a ticket, of course you may pass.
When did he passed the frontier exactly?
It it very nice to pass so difficult exam.
This sword must be passed to their hands.
It is very nice way to pass your time.
Much time passed since that moment.

Word Look
Look, Look at / смотреть
Look + adjective/ выглядеть
Look like + ….............. / выглядеть как
Look alike / выглядеть одинаково (look similar)

Why are you looking there? Did you see something interesting in the sky?
Look at this picture and tell me, whether you see something familiar or not.
You look very exulted. What happened?
In this costume you look like a jest, to be honest
I think that they are the twins because they look alike!
See, watch, glance, stare, gaze, view

What do you see in my eyes?
Don't worry, I will be watching them and prevent any mischief.
Just glance there, you will see a great house.
This boy will stare at you if you tell him about chocolate crisis.
Why are you gazing at me? What happened?
They viewed the picture and rated it highly.

I do too / I don't either
Me too / Me neither
So do I / Neither do I

Unlike these kids, I don't like sugary beverages at all. Me neither.
I like travelling around the world and discover facts are new for me. Me too.
That time I was'nt ready for the exam at all. So neither I.
I feel myself in this garden as in the paradise. So do I.

Compound adjectives
Adjective + V – ing
Adjective + Body pard + -ed
Numbers + Noun

There are many fast-running people among the footbal team.
I did'nt see black-haired man at that meeting you described me.
I was very difficult to carry 50-kilogramm bag here.
He is worthy to be admitted in our team. This film is worthy to be seen.
…........At your best
The pie will be cooked at my best.
…........ As follows
Bring me a book and do everything as follows.
Whether, Whether ... or ..., Whether or not

It is interesting whether theyhave a car.
Whether you are going to help me or leave me?
Where you want to show me the map to allow to help you or not.
So forth
We should discuss books, lessons and so forth.
In advance
I think you should take care about your car in advance.
…...... pretended to be V3
I think he just pretented to be offended, actually he understood the reality very good.
…..... is Adjective of you
It is very nive of you to provide me a horse.
You had to do everything as per instructions, but you decided to act in your own ways.
Years to come
The study will be very difficiult and busy in years to come.
…..... in my/his/hers/their way
I decided to take care about her plants in my way, giving them more water.

This car can carry up to 1 tone of cargo.
I think I will help you up to next year.
The project is ready up to 10 percents.
…..be up to …....
Everything was done up to your recommendations.
Right off the bat
Right off the bat, you should examine very difficult thing about the quantum mechanics.
It is a matter of taste
It is a matter of taste a choice between tea and coffee.
It leaves to be desired
The quality of last supply leaves to be disired.
In his ways
He always do everything in his ways no listening to people who want to help him.
I get the picture.
The truth is he is not going to help us. I get the picture.
I got it.
You should stay away from those bastards. I got it.
Spill the beans
I know it because you friend accidently spilled the beans.
Take into account
You should take into account that there are no people in the town who is eager to help you.
I have a great regard for him
Actually I have a great regard for him, because last year he saved our family from going under.

-Mister Smith, I presume.
-Thats right.

-You must be Mister Smith.
- Thats right.

-Can I offer you a cup of tea?
-Actually, I prefer a tea.
-That makes two of us.

-Would you like another cup of tea?
- Why not?

- Do you mind if I help myself to a glass of sherry?
- Go ahead.

-Can I give you a bit of advice?
-Go ahead.
-Stay away from that haunted house.

-Do you mind if I lie on this hammock?
- Feel free

-May I borrow your pen?
- Be my guest.

-Admit that my style is exellent.
-I admit.
-Thank you.
-You are welcome.

-Want a cracker?
-No, thanks.
-Suit yourself!

-Do you want to eat.
-It's on me.
-I will take a rain check.

-Plese, stay here, I insist.
-I guess I will take a rain check.

-Have an icecream. Spoil yourself!
Well, I don't mind.

-Can I help you with it?
-Thank you. I can manage.

-I will be back in ten minutes.
- It had better be ten minutes.

-You must be a dentist.
-How did you know? -Just a guess.

-What do you do so far?
-Take a wild guess.
-I give up.

-I have some news for you, honey.
-Hold on! Don't tell me.
-Let me guess. You are pregnant.

-You must be very tired.
-You have no idea.

-You are nervous.
-I am not.
-Yes, you are. I can tell.

-You are real bastard.
-I can't tell that right off.
-No offence.
-None taken.

-You are real fool, that what's you are!
-That makes two of us.

-Don't be such a bore!
-Look who is talking!

-You are genuous, Sherlock!
-That I am, that I am.

-You are genious, Sherlock!
-Yoou can say it again.

-You are real bastard.
-You said it.
